description: Special Contract Rates - Service Classification No. 12
notes: This service classification provides discounted or negotiated rates for qualifying non-residential customers who meet eligibility criteria related to retention, growth, revitalization, fuel switching, relocation, and other competitive challenges. Rates are based on eligibility under SC-2D, SC-3, SC-3A, SC-4, or SC-7. Specific rate components are determined by negotiated Customer Service Agreements or standardized discounts as per Sections 5 and 6 of this classification. Minimum bill provisions apply. No explicit rate components (customer charge, energy charge, demand charge, reactive charge) are defined in this text. Refer to the applicable standard tariff rates (SC-2D, SC-3, SC-3A, SC-4, SC-7) for base rate details. This classification acts as a contract vehicle for discounted or negotiated rates and does not itself specify fixed charges or formulas.

description: Standby Service and Optional Rate Service

logic_steps.note: Metering and Communications/Incremental Customer Charge as per Leaf No. 429 (A-E)

notes: Rates apply on a calendar month basis and prorated only if billing period is less than 25 days or more than 35 days.
Standby Service Customers are subject to these rates in accordance with their Parent Service Classification.
Optional Rate Service Customers are subject to their otherwise applicable service classification rates.
Incremental Customer Charge details are referenced to Leaf No. 429 (A-E) and not fully detailed here.
No separate sub-classes (Demand vs Non-Demand) explicitly defined in this text for SC7; single tariff object provided.
No reactive or RKVA charges mentioned for SC7 in the provided text.

description: Untransformed Service to Certain Customers Taking Power from Projects of the New York Power Authority

logic_steps.calculation: billed_demand = max(0, user.billed_demand - (niagara_power_demand + preservation_power_demand + hlf_demand + edp_pfjr_demand))
logic_steps.notes: The billed demand for SC-4 Supplemental Service is the greater of (1) the amount by which the overall max 30-min integrated demand exceeds the sum of demands for Niagara Power Delivery Service, Preservation Power Delivery Service, HLF Delivery Service, and EDP/PFJ Power; (2) the contracted SC-4 Supplemental Service demand; or (3) the minimum demand provisions of the Parent Service Classification.

logic_steps.calculation: billed_kwh = max(0, user.billed_kwh - (niagara_power_kwh + preservation_power_kwh + hlf_kwh + edp_pfjr_kwh))
logic_steps.notes: The billed kWh for SC-4 Supplemental Service is the amount by which total kWh at delivery voltage exceeds the sum of kWh from Niagara Power Delivery Service, Preservation Power Delivery Service, HLF Delivery Service, and EDP/PFJR Service, limited to not exceed actual total metered kWh.
Reactive Demand is the highest average RkVA of lagging reactive demand over a 30-minute interval during the month less one-third of the highest kW demand measured during the month.

notes: Rates, terms and conditions of the applicable Parent Service Classification (SC-3 or SC-3A) apply to SC-4 Supplemental Service except as modified here.
Billing quantities for Niagara Power Delivery Service, Preservation Power Delivery Service, and HLF Delivery Service are determined separately and adjusted for losses as per tariff rules.
SC-4 Supplemental Service is billed on a calendar month basis.
No explicit fixed customer charge or per unit rates are provided in this text for SC-4; charges are based on parent classifications and supplemental service calculations.

description: Combined 25 and 60 Hertz Service
note: Service Classification No. 5 is canceled. No active tariff logic available.

description: Purchase of Electric Energy and Capacity from Customers with Qualifying On-Site Generation Facilities

logic_steps.formula: sum over hours of (Real Time LBMP_i * Q_i) - Incurred Cost
logic_steps.notes: Real Time LBMP in $/MWh; Q_i is energy delivered in kWh per hour; Incurred Cost includes penalties assessed by NYISO.
Capacity is Unforced Capacity recognized by NYISO for the month, capped at 5000 kW for contracts executed on or after July 1, 2019.
Rate to be paid shall be no less than 6.0 cents per kWh, averaged annually and trued-up monthly.

logic_steps.step_name: Non-time Differentiated Energy Option for Small Random Suppliers
logic_steps.notes: For qualifying small suppliers (e.g., windmills) electing non-time differentiated sales, deliveries measured by standard kWh meter; customer pays installed cost of metering equipment instead of other charges.
Customer may receive direct payment from NYISO for Reactive Supply, Regulation, Operating Reserve, Black Start Service, subject to NYISO requirements and contracts.

logic_steps.step_name: Buyback Contract Customer Charge and Demand Charge
logic_steps.description: Customer pays Customer Charge and Buyback Contract Demand Charge based on their otherwise applicable delivery service classification, with conditions for waiver and application when service is taken under both SC-6 and another classification.
logic_steps.application_logic: If customer takes service under both SC-6 and another classification through same connection, Customer Charge waived under SC-6; Demand Charge applies only to Buyback Contract Demand in excess of demand billed under other classification.

logic_steps.notes: Buyback Contract Demand is customer's contract demand unless a higher maximum demand is recorded, which then becomes the Buyback Contract Demand. Reductions allowed once per 365 days. Penalties apply if recorded demand exceeds Buyback Contract Demand by thresholds.

Customer and Company agree on interconnection equipment and payment options: monthly charge of 1.5% of investment if Company owns equipment; 9% annual operating charge if customer owns equipment and Company maintains; or customer owns and maintains equipment.
Company relieved of obligation to purchase energy during system emergencies; customer notified to cease supply.

logic_steps.formula: sum over hours of (Day Ahead LBMP + Avoided Ancillary Services Rate) * Q_i
logic_steps.notes: For solar, biomass, hydro, wind generators <= 5 MW nameplate; capacity provided to Company at no cost; Avoided Ancillary Services Rate calculated from NYISO charges divided by total Ancillary Services MWh purchased.
